member.name: T:Abatab.Abatab
member.remarks:
Abatab receives two things from Avatar:
An OptionObject, which contains all of the information that Abatab needs to do it's thing.
A Script Parameter that tells Abatab what it needs to do with the OptionObject.

member.name: M:Abatab.Abatab.GetVersion
member.summary: Returns the current version of Abatab.

list.item: This method is required by Avatar.
The version number is always the version that is in development.

member.name: M:Abatab.Abatab.RunScript(ScriptLinkStandard.Objects.OptionObject2015,System.String)
member.summary: Executes script parameter request from Avatar, then returns a potentially modified OptionObject to Avatar.
member.param: The original OptionObject sent from Avatar.
The original Script Parameter request from Avatar.
member.returns: A finalized OptionObject that will be returned to Avatar.

list.item: This method is required by Avatar.
This is the only time a Primeval debug log is written.

member.name: T:Abatab.Roundhouse
member.summary: Determines what should be done with the module component of the Script Parameter.

member.name: M:Abatab.Roundhouse.ParseRequest(AbatabData.Session)
member.summary: Parses the Script Parameter and sends valid requests to the proper destination.
member.param: Settings and data for this session of Abatab.

list.item: Only parses the module component of the Script Parameter.
Whenever a new Abatab Module is added, the necessary logic will need to be added here.

member.name: T:Abatab.WebConfig
member.summary: Loads settings from the Web.config file.

member.name: M:Abatab.WebConfig.Load
member.summary: Load the settings from the Web.config file.
member.returns: A dictionary containing the settings from Web.config.

list.item: These configuration settings are setup in src/Properties/Settings.settings, and modified in the Web.config file.
Whenever a new value is added/removed to src/Properties/Settings.settings, it needs to be added/removed here as well.
Settings are trimmed and converted to lowercase.
